resources.string: Take a stroll amongst the trees. You\'ll find this treasure at the feet of Shaw\'s bard.
Look to the towering heights that require no climbing.
Maybe if you see Romeo he can give you a hint.
Head for the market. Going in circles never helps anyone.
Fight through the jungles for this treasure, passing the old polar bear. You\'ll find it in the hands of the gentle giant.
If you stray too much you might end up amongst the elephants or penguins.
Phil seems to have bronzed nicely with age.
Don\'t stay too long with the sea lions, Phil\'s waiting just up ahead!
Say hello to Burroughs, or maybe grandfather Busch. Don\'t stop, though, for it is the explorer you seek.
While you won\'t find Lewis here, seek his companion for your treasure.
This location may have been dedicated in 1850, but it has residents that far surpass it in age.
It shouldn\'t be too hard to find his tower, you\'ll even be greated by his smiling face!
Time to visit the birds. Grab them a snack of peanuts and cracker jacks. Just make sure you stop and see the man!
It is easy to confuse him with the bridge, but you will need to see the man himself to claim your treasure.
If you don\'t get this hint, it\'ll be three strikes, you\'re out!
Look for the tree on the famous stage, the man is waiting!
Time to hike up the hill, maybe you will find a Berry! Look for a fowl friend for your treasure.
Don\'t be so blue, if you\'re goode you\'ll find the treasure!
The flock likes its rock n\' roll loud, so they have their own space just down some stairs.
Maybe you can catch the trolley, make sure you\'re not just going in loops, though!
